lexUnit.name: shine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give out a bright light

sentence.text: A yellow-red light jetted out from the eye-holes of the distorted faces , like a bright beam shining through a keyhole in a door .
Tall stately chimneys , the lights shining from behind mullion-paned windows .
A single , necrotic light shines from a high window , stark against the dark green-grey of the Castle walls .
The light from the lamp shone suddenly on a handsome young man in a bright red and gold army uniform .
A light shone through a chink in the curtains of a window above the garage door .
A dull light shone through the heavy windows .
At that time of year the sun was so low that it shone directly into the livingroom during the whole of its brief traverse of the horizon .
It was very nice in the summer , of course , when the sun shone and sparkled on the wee burn that ran down the hill behind the house .
Another very successful course was held in April ; after the awful winter weather , the sun shone down on Avery Hill College , London , as folk gathered from far and wide to attend .
At the far end of the room , spotlights shone on white tables , upon which cosmetics , in various stages of testing , were spread .
So , if a laser is shone directly into a gas the motion of the atoms relative to the laser will broaden considerably the range of frequencies absorbed .
The moon slowly withdrew itself from its cloudy lair and shone a broad beam of light through the open doorway .
Harriet , hiccuping , stands with the beam shining at her feet , waving it unsteadily up into her eyes .
But to these people , moving like phantoms in and out of the ultra-violet beam which shone from the ceiling , style was everything .
She looked around and saw daylight shining from the end of the hallway .
The moonlight shone into my bedroom , as it did then , and I saw a vision on the ceiling , a white figure looking down on me .
The trapdoor below the golden pavilion opened and a stifled beam of sunlight shone into the cart .
The sun had now lost its rosy tinge and shone extremely painfully into his eyes .
The sunlight from an open window shone into his eyes , and she noticed that they were exactly the same shade of green as Stephen 's , and just as opaque .
Moonlight shone into the room , its rays casting shadows over his hawklike profile , and tears blurred her eyes at the sight .
Her room was lit by a single naked bulb which hung from the ceiling and shone harshly on Ellen who was standing in the doorway of her tiny bathroom .
The warm sunshine of autumn shone on the fields , and on the trees the leaves were red and gold .
The woman looked down , torch beam shining on the ground .
The floodlights shone on the blotchy brown walls of the hangar , the filthy floor , the roof .
Its beams shone through a gap in the pastel blue curtains .
Clear yellow sunlight shone through the window-panes , making a pattern of diamonds on the plasterwork .
He clicked on a torch and a weak beam shone forth .
The moon shone into her eyes .
I was woken by the full moon shining in on me , as I had forgotten to draw my curtains .
The moon was shining on the Great Grimpen Marsh , and a fog was rising from it .
Through the gap in the curtains , also casement cloth , a romantic moon shone down on her , but Sally-Anne had little interest in romance or the moon .
She ran from him , nightmare panic making her breathing and heartbeat echo down the long tree-lined path until she saw the moon shining through a stained-glass window of the garden of Eden .

It was an extraordinary sensation , floating here in the inky darkness , with moonbeams dancing off the top of the small waves , and the twinkling stars above shining through the moth-eaten blanket of the night sky .
